definition: skull/cranium
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
suffix for nouns
lid/top/cover/canopy/to cover/to conceal/to build
surname Ge
skull/cranium
lit. splitting the head and covering the face (idiom); fig. pelting (with rain etc)/showering down

sentences.english: Too much bone in their skulls.
sentences.chinese: 馬的頭蓋上，骨頭太多了。

sentences.english: The newest version of the outrageously fun, smash-hit board game, Cranium?
sentences.chinese: 粗暴樂趣的新版本，搗毀擊中了棋，頭蓋骨？

sentences.english: Remove the cartridge, the case cover and the small cover.
sentences.chinese: 卸下墨盒和左側機箱頭蓋及後小蓋板。

sentences.english: The skull should be fairly long, slightly domed at occiput, with cranium broad and full.
sentences.chinese: 頭部相對較長，後枕骨略微圓拱，頭蓋骨寬而豐滿。

sentences.english: I saw Monk Tang San Zang's head bone.
sentences.chinese: 我看到了唐三藏的頭蓋骨。
傾盆大雨劈頭蓋臉地澆了下來。

sentences.english: Part of his head cover is a sunny yellow.
sentences.chinese: 他的頭蓋部分是一個陽光燦爛的黃色。

sentences.english: It's like a skullcap and looks so awkward.
sentences.chinese: 這就像一個頭蓋骨，看起來很尷尬。

sentences.english: Many congenital hydrocephalics have a dome-shaped, prominent calvarium .
sentences.chinese: 很多原發性水腦症的病例有圓且突出的頭蓋骨。

sentences.english: Bosom husband bridal chamber, hundred flatters thousand jiao red cranium.
sentences.chinese: 知心郎君洞房外，百媚千嬌紅頭蓋。

sentences.english: A cranial trauma with a wound in the parietal region.
sentences.chinese: 在吉拉頭蓋骨的顱頂骨的區域有個傷口。

sentences.english: Questions showered on him by the reporters.
sentences.chinese: 記者們的問題劈頭蓋臉地問了一大堆。

sentences.english: Use human skull as a pot to grow a traditional mini-bonsai.
sentences.chinese: 用頭蓋骨做盆蒔植保守微型盆景。

sentences.english: She has just given him a good scolding right to his face.
sentences.chinese: 她剛纔劈頭蓋臉地給了他一通臭罵。

sentences.english: Continue by bringing the wide end back over in front of the narrow end again.
sentences.chinese: 繼續用寬的一頭蓋過窄的一頭交叉。

definition: head and face filthy with grime (idiom)/covered in dirt/dejected and depressed
lit. head broken and blood flowing/fig. badly bruised
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
to attack with a bladed weapon
wooden sword
to be annoyed/to get angry
red in the face/extremely angry
immediately/at once
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
sound of gong
